item.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Shouldn't Beat Around the Bush With One Key Reveal
item.description:
Hollow Knight: Silksong remains one of the most anticipated indie titles in years. With over six years of teasers, periods of silence, and countless rumors, Team Cherry recently stunned the gaming community at Gamescom by confirming a September 4 release date. For fans who have been waiting since the original Hollow Knight ’s 2017 debut, the announcement felt like a dream come true.

But while the finish line is in sight, one of the biggest mysteries surrounding Silksong remains unresolved: its story. Team Cherry has notoriously kept narrative details about Hollow Knight ’s canon ending locked away, leaving players speculating about the new installment's connection to the original game’s intricate lore. The questions surrounding the canon ending could define how fans interpret Silksong ’s world, its characters, and Hornet’s ultimate role in the series.

Hollow Knight’s Canon Ending Affects Silksong

The original Hollow Knight features multiple endings, each drastically altering the fate of the player character and Hallownest. The most widely accepted “true ending” among fans is Dream No More, which involves defeating the Radiance. However, Team Cherry took a different stance, stating in a Reddit AMA: “All endings are equally canon. We're not into 'True Endings.' You choose the path yourself. We'll do our best in all future Hollow Knight content to account for all of them."

This approach gives players narrative agency, but it also complicates continuity. If every ending is canon, it puts into question how Silksong reconciles these branching fates without erasing the player’s choices or breaking immersion. Hornet’s story cannot exist in a vacuum, unless Silksong is a surprise prequel. It needs to acknowledge Hallownest’s past, even if indirectly.

Hollow Knight Ending Recap

Hollow Knight has five endings, excluding a secret post-credits scene. Quickly, players will notice that these endings are drastically different from one another. And with so much variance, Silksong ’s narrative has to pick a lane, or at least create a framework that makes sense regardless of which ending players believe in.

Ending

How it Plays Out

The Hollow Knight

The Hollow Knight dies, and the Knight absorbs the infection. The Knight is sealed inside the Black Egg. Players must not have acquired the Void Heart in order to achieve this ending.

Sealed Siblings

The Hollow Knight dies, thanks to a heroic save by Hornet. Players will have had to acquire the Void Heart to unlock this ending.

Embrace the Void

After defeating the Absolute Radiance, the infection is purged and the Godseeker embraces the void. The Knight's shell is broken in half, implying that the Knight has died or returned to the Void. This ending is tied to the Godmaster DLC.

Delicate Flower

After having completed the Delicate Flower side quest, the Delicate Flower purges the infection. It plays out similarly to Embrace the Void.

Dream No More

The Radiance is defeated, destroying the infection with her. The Knight and the Hollow Knight are implied to have met their end in this ending.

Why the Canon Question Matters for Silksong

Hollow Knight ’s lore is one of its strongest pillars. The game’s environmental storytelling captivated players by rewarding exploration with bits of history, mysteries of the Pale King, and the slow unraveling of what the infection truly meant. Yet the fragmented nature of these revelations left plenty of gaps for interpretation.

Silksong doesn’t need to tie up every loose end, but it does need to anchor itself within the established mythos. Without that grounding, the game risks feeling detached from the weight of the first game’s tragedy and the fate of Hallownest’s characters.

Moreover, Hornet is no ordinary character. As the Pale King’s daughter and a central figure in the original game’s lore, her perspective on the infection and its resolution should logically influence her motivations in Pharloom. If the Void was destroyed, that creates one set of implications. If it persists, that opens entirely different doors for conflict and narrative stakes.

The Case for Dream No More

Of all Hollow Knight’s endings, Dream No More feels the most narratively complete. In this conclusion, the Knight defeats the Radiance within the dream realm, effectively ending the infection’s source. The Hollow Knight, once a vessel of hope, disappears as a martyr, and Hallownest is finally freed from its eternal decay.

From a thematic standpoint, this resolution delivers closure without erasing the cost. It also establishes a foundation for future stories where remnants of Hallownest linger, but the central infection crisis is over. For Silksong , that would allow Hornet’s journey to stand on its own while acknowledging the monumental sacrifices that came before.

Why Silksong Should Address This Soon

Silksong doesn’t need an opening cinematic with a narrator declaring that the Radiance was slain, and the Void has returned to the abyss. But it does need something to contextualize Hornet’s circumstances. A passing reference in dialogue, a ruined monument in Pharloom, or even a lore entry could serve as a tether between the two games. Leaving this ambiguity unresolved risks creating narrative dissonance. Players who view Embrace the Void as canon might expect Silksong to explore Hornet’s reaction to an all-consuming Void, while others assume Sealed Siblings may anticipate lingering infection threads. Without clarification, Silksong could unintentionally fracture fan expectations in ways that hinder the emotional impact of its story.

item.title: August 29 Will Be a Big Day for Genshin Impact Fans
item.description:
Genshin Impact fans are in for some major announcements within just a few days, with HoYoverse officially confirming the date and time for the Version 6.0 Special Program. The massively popular HoYoverse RPG is just a couple of weeks away from its biggest update of the year, with Genshin Impact gearing up to debut its next playable region. Nod-Krai will serve as the first playable segment of the long-rumored region of Snezhnaya, with major factions like the Fatui, Hexenzirkel, and Knights of Favonius said to be involved. HoYoverse is now getting ready to pull back the curtain on Nod-Krai.

Genshin Impact has already showcased plenty of new content coming to the game during the Version 6.0 update. Nod-Krai's launch update will introduce three brand-new characters to the game's playable roster, with Lauma, Aino, and Flins all set to make their Genshin Impact debut during the patch. HoYoverse has also shown off several areas within Nod-Krai that players will be able to explore, including the Frostmoon Scions' home of Hiisi Island and Nasha Town among others. Now, Genshin Impact has officially announced its next big livestream reveal.

HoYoverse officially announced the date and time for Genshin Impact 's Version 6.0 Special Program livestream late Tuesday night. The developer confirmed that its newest livestream broadcast focused around the Nod-Krai region will officially air on Friday, August 29, with the start time for the main program set for 8:00 A.M. EDT. HoYoverse also revealed that it will feature a "special guest segment" directly before and after the livestream, starting 9 minutes earlier at 7:51 A.M. EDT. The developer teased its typical redemption codes to be distributed throughout the livestream, alongside "other goodies."

Genshin Impact Version 6.0 Special Program Airs on August 29

  • August 29, 8:00 A.M. EDT
  • Guest segment begins at 7:51 A.M. EDT

The Version 6.0 Special Program is expected to be jam-packed with big news for Genshin Impact 's next update. HoYoverse will likely share the first major teasers about Nod-Krai's main story, alongside previewing some of the new enemies, characters, and music players will encounter during the update. The key visual for the presentation also teases some future characters who will be featured in Version 6.0's story, including Fatui Harbingers Sandrone and Columbina among others. Genshin Impact 's Version 6.0 is scheduled to officially launch on September 10.

Genshin Impact 's newest region looks to be bringing plenty of major changes beyond Nod-Krai and its new cast of characters. Genshin Impact is heavily rumored to be upgrading its Battle Pass as part of the Version 6.0 update, adding multiple new rewards for players to acquire when leveling up the pass. HoYoverse has also confirmed that the developer will begin to sunset Genshin Impact 's PS4 client, removing the PS4 version from the PlayStation Store and ceasing any new updates on PS4. Genshin Impact has some big changes on the horizon with its new region launching in just a couple of weeks.

item.title: Helldivers 2’s Newly Revealed Warbond and Update are a Blessing and a Curse
item.description:
Following its Xbox debut, Helldivers 2 has revealed a fresh update on the horizon. Titled "Into the Unjust," this new offering of content brings players deep into Terminid territory, as Helldivers 2 gives a closer look at this alien race's Hive Worlds. Between the game's launch on Xbox, a brand-new Halo -inspired crossover, and now Into the Unjust, Helldivers 2 players have a lot to celebrate, but there are also some major downsides to the update.

The timing of Helldivers 2 's newest update is far from ideal. Into the Unjust is scheduled to arrive on September 2, followed by its Dust Devils Premium Warbond on September 4. The promise of this new content being right around the corner is great, but there's a huge juggernaut bound to overshadow the moment: Hollow Knight: Silksong .

Hollow Knight: Silksong comes to both Nintendo Switches, PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X/S on September 4. It will also be a day-one Xbox Game Pass release.

Hollow Knight: Silksong Could Throw a Wrench Into Helldivers 2's September Plans

While the arrival of a brand-new Warbond is exciting, it pales in comparison to the arrival of Silksong . The highly-anticipated sequel to 2017's Hollow Knight has been eagerly awaited for years now, and with developer Team Cherry surprise-announcing at Gamescom that the game is only a few weeks away, the hype is now greater than ever. Of course, there are bound to be plenty of hardcore Helldivers 2 fans more excited about the Warbond launch than Silksong , but with the latter also being an Xbox Game Pass launch, the third-person shooter may be at risk of quickly losing some of its fresh Xbox players, at least for a little while.

Silksong 's release date has even caused some games to delay their launch. A few of these titles include Baby Steps and Aeterna Lucis .

Helldivers 2 Offering a Double Dose of Warbond Could Backfire

In honor of Helldivers 2 coming to Xbox, the game celebrated with a Halo 3: ODST Warbond upon its launch. This Warbond has barely been available for a day, so the announcement of another Warbond right around the corner is a strange decision on developer Arrowheads Game Studios' part.

On the one hand, this extra Warbond offering is likely being used as a way to retain new players while also catering to Helldivers 2 fans who aren't invested in Halo content. However, this could also give the Xbox crowd the wrong idea about how often to expect Warbonds. The bright side is that Medals can at least have two solid ways to be spent within the next week or two, but that doesn't change the fact that both Warbonds won't have much time to breathe in their own space.

This week has been a big moment for both Xbox and PlayStation. On the same day that Sony-published Helldivers 2 came to Xbox, Gears of War: Reloaded launched for PS5, marking the first time that the flagship Xbox franchise has ever been available on a Sony console.

Helldivers 2 Coming to Xbox is a Game-Changer

This is a huge milestone for the popular third-person shooter. When it launched at the beginning of last year, Helldivers 2 proved to be one of the most surprising games of 2024, and it will be fascinating to see how it fares on Xbox. Helldivers 2 's upcoming Into the Unjust update looks like a great way to introduce Xbox fans to its harrowing world, but Silksong could potentially be too much of a distraction.

Of course, only time will tell, but Helldivers 2 could easily see a shake-up in its player count once Silksong arrives. The timing on Helldivers 2 's part may not be the greatest, but it's also thrilling to know that the third-person shooter and one of gaming's most-anticipated indie sequels are gearing up to kick off the month of September in a big way.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Grace and Alyssa Face Models Confirmed
item.description:
The face models for Resident Evil Requiem protagonist Grace Ashcroft and her mother, Alyssa, have recently been confirmed. Resident Evil Requiem is one of the most eagerly awaited horror games coming in 2026, and Capcom is continuously unveiling more information about it.

Announced during Summer Game Fest 2025, Resident Evil Requiem is the next entry in Capcom’s popular survival horror franchise, and it’s set to be released on February 27, 2026. To the surprise of many gamers, Resident Evil Requiem ’s protagonist will be Grace Ashcroft, an FBI agent who is currently investigating deaths at a mysterious hotel. Grace is the daughter of Alyssa Ashcroft, who starred in Resident Evil Outbreak and was said to have died in the same hotel. The game’s story will be set around 30 years after Raccoon City’s destruction in Resident Evil 3: Nemesis , but most details about the plot are still unknown.

Resident Evil Requiem's Face Models for Grace and Alyssa Revealed

  • Grace will be played by Julia Pratt
  • Alyssa will be played by Kate Delic

Now, prominent leaker Dusk Golem has compiled a few interviews about Resident Evil Requiem , which reveal some interesting information about the upcoming title. It was confirmed in these interviews that Julia Pratt will be the face model for Grace, and Kate Delic will be the one for Alyssa. Dusk Golem also shared some other details, such as that zombies are confirmed as the game’s main enemies, but there’s a large spectrum of monsters that will be featured during the story. The leaker also revealed that Alyssa was the “natural choice” as the protagonist of Resident Evil Requiem because the developers were interested in investigating the hidden truths of the city. However, Raccoon City will not be the only main setting of the survival horror game.

The reports do not talk about Leon Kennedy being part of Resident Evil Requiem , though. Multiple rumors, including some started by Dusk Golem, have pointed to Leon’s presence in the game as one of the protagonists. However, if this information is to be confirmed, Capcom seems to be playing its cards close to the chest, as this was not acknowledged in any recent interview.

Gamers who are curious to discover more details about the next entry in the franchise should watch out for September 24, as Resident Evil Requiem will be featured at the Tokyo Game Show 2025. It’s currently unknown what will be shown during the event, but it’s possible that some major announcements concerning Resident Evil Requiem will be made, revealing more important details about its gameplay, story, and setting.

item.title: It's Your Last Chance to Claim the Latest Epic Games Store Free Games
item.description:
Gamers are running out of time to claim the latest free titles on offer from Epic Games Store : Strange Horticulture and Kamaeru . Since it first went live in December 2018, the online video game storefront has given away a free game or two, at first every two weeks and later on a weekly basis. Initially, this was intended to be a temporary marketing move to entice gamers to the newly launched digital marketplace, but Epic Games Store has so far not done away with the generous offer.

The next batch of games to claim for free will be 2009’s Machinarium and 2023’s Make Way. The former is an award-winning adventure about a robot on a mission to save his girlfriend. Amanita Design is the developer behind the Samorost series and Botanicula , and has earned a reputation for creating unique and aesthetically memorable games. Make Way by Ice Beam is a zany multiplayer racing game where players must first build the tracks they'll wreak havoc on, complete with obstacles, corkscrews, and power-ups. These two titles will become available to claim for free from the Epic Games Store on August 28 at 8 AM PST.

Epic Games Store’s Free Titles Change on August 28

That means there is only a short time left to grab the two titles that became available to claim for free from Epic Games Store on August 21. The first, Strange Horticulture , is a mystery puzzle game developed by Bad Viking that was released in 2022. In this award-winning title, players are the owner of a plant store in the somewhat odd town of Undermere. In addition to welcoming a unique lineup of customers, they will discover and catalog a wide range of strange plants while unraveling a local “occult mystery.” Strange Horticulture has an 84 average score on OpenCritic and a 4.6 user rating on EGS.

Kamaeru: A Frog Refuge , developed by Humble Reeds and released in 2024, is another opportunity for players to collect and catalog things, but frogs this time. In this cozy game, rather than a plant shop, players are tasked with creating a thriving sanctuary by breeding, raising, and caring for up to 500 different frogs. They can plant crops and dig ponds to recreate natural habitats while also doing a bit of decorating. Kamaeru is currently sitting at a 71 average on OpenCritic and has a 4.2 user rating on the Epic Games Store.

Machinarium and Make Way will be the last free titles offered by the Epic Games Store in August, rounding out an exciting month for gamers. The eight games given away this month had players solving puzzles, dispatching rescue services, delivering packages with friends, and leading a biker gang across the country. And it will only be a short wait until EGS reveals the first free games coming in September.
